In Grimms' and Perrault's versions of the tale, she is named after her magical red hooded cape\/cloak that she wears. The girl walks through the woods to deliver food to her sickly grandmother. In the Grimms' version, her mother had ordered her to stay strictly on the path. A Big Bad Wolf wants to eat the girl and the food in the basket.
